alert.note: Alert for Madera (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 02 at 11:26PM PDT until April 03 at 6:30PM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: .High flows through the San Joaquin River due to releases from Friant Dam are expected to continue for at least a few more days. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR A DAM FLOODGATE RELEASE NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM PDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by upstream dam release continues. * WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following counties, Fresno and Madera. * WHEN...Until 900 AM PDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1125 PM PDT, an upstream floodgate release is expected to cause minor flooding in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fresno, Mendota, Biola, Friant and Millerton Lake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
